body: Hey. If you want to cherry-pick this pr to a target branch, please comments '/pulsarbot cherry-pick to branch-x.y'.
I've updated the page to the latest release https://github.com/apache/pulsar/wiki/Client-Features-Matrix

I think we need to add a workflow to remember update this page before each release.
Thank you all for your reminder.

@hangc0276  => Yup, I am trying to understand the issue and looking for a fix.

@lxcid => Thanks for the lead..

@holmes07 

Please use this following command. It is documented in the README.

```
cd ${PULSAR_HOME}/pulsar-common/
./generate_protobuf_docker.sh
```

---

@Jennifer88huang We might consider update the protobuf/readme.md file to make it clear.

got it . i will try it later.  thanks ~
@Jennifer88huang Thanks for the update! However it's not enough, there's a dozen of other features that clients should support and they should also be reflected on the matrix

> One question, with an Exclusive Producer, what happens if I delete and recreate a topic?
> 
> * create a topic
> * start ex producer  and write
> * delete/create the same topic
> * is the producer still valid?
>   I expect the ex producer to be fenced out.
>   Is this the case?

Deleting the topic will delete all the state associated with the topic. If the topic is re-created, it's effectively a different topic. All the state associated with the topic is gone: subscriptions, dedup state, fencing.

The topic epoch will be reset after the deletion, so it should allow the producer. I will add specific test for this.

@Lanayx Thanks. Would you like to update on the WIKI page?
I was wondering whether it would be better to add a table directly in http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/next/client-libraries/#feature-matrix

@Jennifer88huang it really might be better to move it to the site page as it would allow sending PRs there. I can enumerate the features that should be added, but the research should be made to figure out which libraries support which features. As for features I can name: e2e encryption, batchReceive, statistics, receive cancellation, batchIndex acks, chunking support, retryLetterTopic, SNI, producer blockIfQueueFull and I must have missed some other features as well

@Lanayx Would you like to create a table in http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/next/client-libraries/#feature-matrix and add the features you mentioned here? Or we can create the table, so everyone can help to update with PRs.
Never mind that you might miss some, you can add more in the following PRs.

I have pulled the latest version of apachepulsar/pulsar-standalone:latest and confirmed that the 4.12 version of the BookKeeper jars are now in the /pulsar/lib folder. 

`org.apache.bookkeeper-stream-storage-java-client-4.12.0.jar`
`com.google.guava-guava-30.0-jre.jar`

@zymap It's better to wait for #8784 merged because this PR doesn't specify the spotbugs' version.
@flowchartsman Can you take a look at this change?
@codelipenghui I saw you commit the changelog for 2.7.0 and no mention of this enhancement, is all ok?
If we want to customize the settings of `conusmerName` and `subName` separately, this way cannot be done. So is it better to add a `subName`?

It's better to have two seperate setting for `subName` and `consumerName` if we want to distinguish different consumers in a same subscription.  Actually, internal subscription of reader is EXCLUSIVE type,  so maybe it's not necessary to distinguish consumers. 
What I'm considering is that if we have all of  `readerName`, `subscriptionName` and `consumerName`, it's will bring some complexity for understanding.

I pushed updates to use the user's id instead of name, and I pushed an update to properly chown the added directories in the `pulsar-all` `Dockerfile`. After fully building the project tonight, I noticed that the `pulsar-standalone` image still runs as the root user and that all of its directories are owned by `root` or by `postgres`. That docker image looks a bit more complicated than the `pulsar` and `pulsar-all` images, so I am going to refrain from updating that `Dockerfile`.
This PR would also fix issue https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/7210.

Fixing this issue is simple. But if we modify the rules of name generation when DLQ is automatically created, there will be backward compatibility issues. So it needs to be discussed.

The current generation rules are as follows:
```Java
String deadLetterTopic = topicFirst.getNamespace() + "/" 
+ conf.getSubscriptionName() + RetryMessageUtil.DLQ_GROUP_TOPIC_SUFFIX;
```
This issue can you help to resolve it? @zhanghaou @shaojie
There has a fix for the integration tests cli. If it failed again, please rebase your code.
At MagNews.com we are on 2.6.2, is it possible to cherry pick to 2.6.3 as well @codelipenghui ?
